alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued November 26 at 2:28AM PST until November 27 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PST MONDAY... ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 8 to 11 feet with dangerous rip currents through tonight, then elevated surf of 6 to 9 feet Monday. Minor tidal overflow and coastal flooding possible around the time of the morning high tides. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Beaches and Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 3 AM PST Monday. For the Beach Hazards Statement, from late tonight through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Minor coastal flooding is possible during the morning high tides of 6.7 to 7.1 feet. High tide is at 817 AM PST this morning and 851 AM PST Monday morning. Surf will be highest on west and northwest facing beaches.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly locations in such conditions, so stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches
